channel.title: A legitimate and mature question
channel.description:
I'm using yell to send server message for things like Castle Wars games starting/ending, current champions of fight pits, etc.
Problem is, say there's 3 people in fight pits, and the game ends. Since there's 3 people, the server spits out the "Fight Pits has ended" message [i]three[/i] times!
Is there any way I can replace yell with something that only sends the message to all players [i]once[/i], regardless of how many players there is?
Would sM work? Would it send the message to [i]all[/i] players? It seems to me that it wouldn't, though I haven't tried.
Any help is appreciated. PsychoScapeRSPS, known as KeepBotting on some sites.

@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:10, topic:446302”][quote author=PsychoScapeRSPS link=topic=549171.msg4026413#msg4026413 date=1340373350]

[quote author=Whackatre link=topic=549171.msg4026409#msg4026409 date=1340373078]

Change yell to sM. What you’re currently doing is yelling the message for each player instance.
[/quote]Will that send the message to ALL players on the server?

It should occur for all players with these conditions:

if(isInPitGame() && PlayerHandler.pitsWaitTimer == 45 && inPitsGame)

[/quote]Yeah but I want it to send to ALL players on the server. How would I do that?

In PlayerHandler, add a check PlayerHandler.pitsWaitTimer == 45. Put your yell code there.[/quote]Okay, thank you very much for your help. Rep++ for you, good sir.
